abstract.text: Show off your watchOS app‚Äôs complications and create a watch face worth sharing. Learn how to share watch faces inside your watchOS and iOS apps or host them on the web for anyone to find and download. We‚Äôll also explore best practices for using watch face preview images, and show you how to create a smooth installation experience.

inlineContent.text: Be the hero to change that by watching the video and providing notes! It‚Äôs super easy:

abstract.text: When you add complications to a Watch app, people can access glanceable and up to date information directly from their watch face. We‚Äôll show you how to create and build complications from the ground up and introduce you to Multiple Complications. Learn how to construct timelines, use families and templates, and discover best practices on crafting a thorough complication experience.

Discover StoreKit Testing in Xcode ‚Äî a local environment for testing your in-app purchases without needing to connect to App Store servers. We‚Äôll show you how to set up a test environment, create a StoreKit configuration file, and prepare to validate receipts locally. We‚Äôll also explain how to test a variety of in-app purchase scenarios and automate those tests with the StoreKitTest framework, and cover the latest improvements to testing in the sandbox environment.

Scribble offers a lightweight, ergonomic, and enjoyable way of entering text on iPad with Apple Pencil. Discover how people can take advantage of Scribble and handwritten text in apps that use standard text input controls or that implement a custom text editing experience. You‚Äôll learn how it integrates into TextKit, and when you‚Äôll need to adopt the new UIScribbleInteraction and UIIndirectScribbleInteraction APIs to provide a delightful and consistent experience with Scribble in your app.

Fine-tune your audio app or plug-in for Apple silicon Macs: We‚Äôll show you how to register your realtime threads using Audio Workgroups and make your app sing. Learn more about the power efficiency of System on a Chip (SoC) and how you can take advantage of new APIs to improve the speed and sound of your apps and plug-ins.

You can now store car keys on iPhone or Apple Watch. You no longer have to bring your key fob to unlock and start your car. And with digital keys, it‚Äôs easy to share them with family or friends, and manage keys remotely.

Face ID and Touch ID provide a frictionless experience when logging in ‚Äî and now you can use them on your websites in Safari with the Web Authentication API. Discover how to add this convenient and secure login alternative to your website.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Meet Face ID and Touch ID for the web

abstract.text: When you create a Safari Web Extension, you can help people get common online tasks done more quickly and efficiently. We‚Äôll show you how to build a new Safari Web Extension and host it on the App Store, as well as how to use the safari-web-extension-converter tool to migrate existing extensions from other web browsers like Chrome, Firefox, or Edge with very little effort.
Xcode 12, Swift 5.3, iOS 13, macOS 11, tvOS 14, watchOS 7.

Let people select photos and videos to use in your app without requiring full Photo Library access. Discover how the PHPicker API for iOS and Mac Catalyst ensures privacy while providing your app the features you need.
Session notes shared by the community for the community.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Keep your complications up to date

abstract.text: Time is of the essence: Discover how your Apple Watch complications can provide relevant information throughout the day and help people get the information they need, when they need it. Learn best practices for capitalizing on your app‚Äôs runtime opportunities, incorporating APIs like background app refresh and URLSession, and implementing well-timed push notifications.

Spice up your graphic complications on Apple Watch using SwiftUI. We‚Äôll teach you how to use custom SwiftUI views in complications on watch faces like Meridian and Infograph, look at some best practices when creating your complications, and show you how to preview your work in Xcode 12.

The Nearby Interaction framework streams distance and direction between opted-in Apple devices containing the U1 chip. Discover how this powerful combination of hardware and software allow you to create intuitive spatial interactions based on the relative position of two or more devices. We‚Äôll walk you through this session-based API and show you how to deliver entirely new interactive experiences ‚Äî all with privacy in mind.

Meet WidgetKit: the best way to bring your app‚Äôs most useful information directly to the home screen. We‚Äôll show you what makes a great widget and take a look at WidgetKit‚Äôs features and functionality. Learn how to get started creating a widget, and find out how WidgetKit leverages the power of SwiftUI to provide a stateless experience. Discover how to harness your existing proactive technologies to make sure your widget surfaces relevant material. And create a Timeline that ensures your content is always fresh.
